body.p: We shall be delighted to participate in the festivities of Mary’s Mary Talfourd (1828-1901), the elder of Talfourd’s two daughters; married William Wreford Major, April 1856. birthday. – I was going to say Little Mary’s, but Heaven help us – she must be dreadfully big by this time! Mrs. HarrisMrs Gamp and her imaginary friend Mrs Harris first appeared in the August 1843 No. of Martin Chuzzlewit (Ch. 19). For another Mrs Harris joke, see To Ely, [29 Nov 43] (Pilgrim Letters 3, p. 602). says, only last evenin, as she never see a hand which giv her sech pleasure as yourn;Ely’s handwriting was a running joke with CD: see e.g. To Ely, 2 Dec 44 (Pilgrim Letters 4). not only on account of its bein sech a beautiful hand in itself, but because of its bein so familiar in the hold times as is gone and past fora hevermore amen.
